Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content: Payment channels should be cheaper than using blockchains which need to write to multiple places. Payment channels only write to multiple places if there's a dispute. In an optimal world, that shouldn't happen too often at all.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: We can make using the blockchain itself cheap, what's the benefit of payment channels?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I can think of one, instant trustless confirmation

Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content: Like I said, I'm struggling with a basic math equation here, like 1+1. Blockchains need to write to multiple places in order to be trustless. That will never be cheaper than writing to one place. That's why blockchains can serve as the trustless dispute arbiter. What am I missing?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: this `That will never be cheaper than writing to one place.`

Author: Alright#0419
Content: with a fungible chain cluster, if there is a need to increase transactions per second, make another chain. Simple

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: why complicate things with something that can never work ... LN requires routing to be solved... which was NEVER even solved by the internet... Routing is a trusted system on the internet that uses a reactionary security model... if someone does something bad they need to be identified them removed from the system... Blockchain doesnt need that, it has consesnsus rules, you cant break them... No trust.

Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content:
"My biggest problem with Lightning is that some middle man can say "we won't let you pay this corp". Surely the corp won't open payment channels with just anyone"

Lightning will enable an economic reason to migrate away from corporations in the first place. I look forward to an entirely peer to peer transactional world. Corporations / governments can try to regulate it, but it can't. People will use dApps because they will be cheaper than going through corps. If corps want to limit where you can send your money, they will simply lose customers, they will lose any economic advantage they have as incumbents. The fact is, KYC can be done in a trustless manner, using zero knowledge proofs, etc. KYC should not be a hang up if all of this technology gets built.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: If thats what you want, then you DO NOT want LN üòÇ

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I'm probably not the best person to debate this. I'm not saying that LN is entirely infeasible. I'm saying there is no need for it, and the people saying we *need* it are doing harmful things such as creating artificial scarcity in block size

Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content: The reason why blockchain isn't mainstream is because it's expensive and isn't scalable. The tech that solves this issue will enable that world. I don't care what tech it is. But again, if you want to compete with centralized entities, I don't see how writing information to more places than centralized solutions  do will allow us to do that.

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: \ escapes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the "every client needs to provide specific routing" requirement will force having a small number of large hubs, each publishing partial routing tables to the other large hubs and all nodes would need to open channels to these large hubs. Unless you can think of some other way to solve how every node can know the route to all other nodes in a practical data transmission way

Author: Daiyox#2701
Content: Thanks @ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: further complicating the routing is that each payment changes the channel capacity of each node on the route, thus changing the viable route in cases where there are too much funds transferred. Maybe such cases can be ignored and just retry after a failed route, but not sure how long it takes to reclaim all the funds locked in the invalid route

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: imagine you are traveling across the world and need to use planes to get from A to B. but you need to buy tickets for 1000 travelers. As plans along the best route fill up, the tickets you need change and if you have to change an already commited channel and shut it down, that takes time and costs txfees. when BTC txfees are 0.0001 it is bad enough but if it gets back to 0.001...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you basically need to know every planes schedule, their capacity, how many places they have left

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in realtime

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then ignore the time it takes to setup channels, since it takes multiple confirmations and amounts in excess of what you want to transact to be deposited

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: now you are all setup, you can send invoices to the other nodes and hope it is all processed in a timely fashion and no node along the route decided to shutdown its channel

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I dont know about you, but I have enough difficult technical problems to solve, without having to solve an NP complete problem with no reliable good solution

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: internet routing uses a trusted system of backbone providers that share their route information with each other and decide node by node how to route it. with LN, the original sender needs to figure out the route and specify it with the payment

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so this is a much harder problem than internet routing, as it requires trustless routing and the simple act of sending funds changes the routing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if solving the above is easy for you, please go and solve it and become famous for solving a near impossible problem

Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content: So it's like a level 2 chaotic system? Thank you for taking the time to explain this. I understand it more now. I have to digest this and ask around. Have you talked about this with devs who support LN? I feel like there may be another side to the story.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sure the other side is that eventually someone will become famous by solving this problem

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but until it is solved, it is unsolved

Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content: Haha

Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content: So internet routing uses a trusted system of backbone providers. What prevents this from being trustless? I assume we can't do something like require providers deposit funds equal to the amount being sent. If providers send inaccurate routing information, they lose their deposit?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that would ensure very few providers will provide

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: already the channels hubs need to lock funds,to have to put up more deposits for providing routing info seems strange

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: usually when you are providing a service you get paid for it, instead of having to pay for it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the game theory for LN is not very well thought out

Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content: You do get paid for it, but you get punished for services non rendered.
